options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --sample-name
options.description: Override the basename of the output fastq file. Default is the basename of the first input file without extension and read 1 identifier.

options.name: --mismatches
options.description: The number of mismatches allowed (given as fraction)

options.name: --remove-polyg
options.description: Remove PolyG sequences (length of 10 or more)

options.name: --quality-cutoff
options.description: Remove bases from the tail with a Phred score lower then the cutoff value.

options.name: --skip-input-checks
options.description: Skip all check on the filename of input fastq files.

options.name: --force-run
options.description: If more than 50% of reads are filtered, this indicates some serious problem with the input data and the amplicon commandwill fail with an exit status of 1. Setting this flag will force an exit status of 0.

options.name: --threads
options.description: The number of total worker threads available for parallel processing

options.name: --mismatches
options.description: The number of mismatches allowed in marker barcodes

options.name: --output-chunk-reads
options.description: The target number of molecules in each output parquet file

options.name: --output-max-chunks
options.description: The maximum number of marker parts to split the demuxed data into

options.name: --strategy
options.description: The strategy for splitting demuxed files. 'paired' will split files by batches of PID pairs'independent' will create two partitions of files split by marker1 and marker2 independently.

options.name: --threads
options.description: The number of total worker threads available for parallel processing

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --panel
options.description: The name of a panel to load from the supported panels. Optionally, provide a path to a custom panel file.

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --mismatches
options.description: The number of mismatches allowed when collapsing.

options.name: --algorithm
options.description: The network based algorithm to use for collapsing.

options.description: The number of total worker threads available for parallel processing

options.name: --panel
options.description: The name of a panel to load from the supported panels. Optionally, provide a path to a custom panel file.

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --multiplet-recovery
options.description: Activate the multiplet recovery using leiden community detection

options.name: --leiden-iterations
options.description: Number of iterations for the leiden algorithm, high values will decrease the variance of the results but increase the runtime

options.name: --initial-stage-leiden-resolution
options.description: The resolution parameter for the leiden algorithm at the initial stage. This should typically be set higher than the refinement stage resolution.

options.name: --refinement-stage-leiden-resolution
options.description: The resolution parameter for the leiden algorithm at the refinement stage. This should typically be set lower than the initial stage resolution.

options.name: --min-count
options.description: Discard edges with a read count below given value. Set to 1 to disable filtering.

options.name: --min-component-size-in-refinement
options.description: The minimum component size to consider for refinement

options.name: --max-refinement-recursion-depth
options.description: The maximum recursion depth for the refinement algorithm. Set to 1 to disable refinement.

options.name: --min-component-size-to-prune
options.description: The minimum number of nodes in an potential new components in order for it to be pruned.

options.name: --component-size-max-threshold
options.description: Components with more nodes than this will be filtered from the output data. This is typically not needed. Setting this will disable the automatic size filtering.

options.name: --component-size-min-threshold
options.description: Components with fewer nodes than this will be filtered from the output data. This is typically not needed. Setting this will disable the automatic size filtering.

options.name: --panel
options.description: The name of a panel to load from the supported panels. Optionally, provide a path to a custom panel file.

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --compute-proximity
options.description: Compute proximity scores matrix

options.name: --proximity-nbr-of-permutations
options.description: Number of permutations to use when calculating the expected proximity scores

options.name: --compute-k-cores
options.description: Compute k-core summary tables for each component

options.name: --compute-svd-var-explained
options.description: Compute variance explained for top 3 singular vectors for each component

options.name: --svd-nbr-of-pivots
options.description: Number of pivots to use for SVD variance explained computation

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --layout-algorithm
options.description: Select a layout algorithm to use. This can be specified multiple times to compute multiple layouts. Default: pmds_3d

options.name: --pmds-pivots
options.description: Number of pivots to use for the PMDS layout algorithm. Default: 50. More give better results, but increase computation times.

options.name: --wpmds-k
options.description: The window size used when computing probability weights to the wpmds layout method. Only used when the wpmds layout method is selected. Default: 3.

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --parquet-pattern
options.description: The pattern to match parquet files.

options.name: --report-pattern
options.description: The pattern to match report files.

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)
